commit.message:
configure.in: Don't check for bcopy.

	* configure.in: Don't check for bcopy.
	* configure, config.in: Regenerate.

	* system.h: Don't define or prototype bcopy, instead poison it.

From-SVN: r40898

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,10 @@
+2001-03-27  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
+
+	* configure.in: Don't check for bcopy.
+	* configure, config.in: Regenerate.
+
+	* system.h: Don't define or prototype bcopy, instead poison it.
+
 2001-03-27  Richard Henderson  <rth@redhat.com>
 
 	* function.c (expand_function_start): Set DECL_REGISTER on

@@ -98,9 +98,6 @@
 /* Define if you have the atoq function.  */
 #undef HAVE_ATOQ
 
-/* Define if you have the bcopy function.  */
-#undef HAVE_BCOPY
-
 /* Define if you have the bsearch function.  */
 #undef HAVE_BSEARCH
 
@@ -359,9 +356,6 @@
 /* Define if read-only mmap of a plain file works. */
 #undef HAVE_MMAP_FILE
 
-/* Define to 1 if we found this declaration otherwise define to 0. */
-#undef HAVE_DECL_BCOPY
-
 /* Define to 1 if we found this declaration otherwise define to 0. */
 #undef HAVE_DECL_GETENV

@@ -3097,7 +3097,7 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 
-for ac_func in strtoul bsearch putenv popen bcopy \
+for ac_func in strtoul bsearch putenv popen \
 	strchr strrchr kill getrlimit setrlimit atoll atoq \
 	sysconf isascii gettimeofday strsignal putc_unlocked fputc_unlocked \
 	fputs_unlocked getrusage iconv nl_langinfo
@@ -4253,19 +4253,18 @@ fi
 # We will need to find libiberty.h and ansidecl.h
 saved_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
 CFLAGS="$CFLAGS -I${srcdir} -I${srcdir}/../include"
-for ac_func in bcopy \
-	getenv atol sbrk abort atof getcwd getwd \
+for ac_func in getenv atol sbrk abort atof getcwd getwd \
 	strsignal putc_unlocked fputs_unlocked strstr environ \
 	malloc realloc calloc free basename getopt
 do
   ac_tr_decl=HAVE_DECL_`echo $ac_func | tr 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4264: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:4263: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4269 "configure"
+#line 4268 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #undef $ac_tr_decl
 #define $ac_tr_decl 1
@@ -4279,7 +4278,7 @@ char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func ;
 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4283: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4282: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -4306,10 +4305,6 @@ fi
 done
 if test x = y ; then
   cat >> confdefs.h <<EOF
-#define HAVE_DECL_BCOPY 1
-EOF
- \
-	cat >> confdefs.h <<EOF
 #define HAVE_DECL_GETENV 1
 EOF
  cat >> confdefs.h <<EOF
@@ -4372,12 +4367,12 @@ for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit getrusage
 do
   ac_tr_decl=HAVE_DECL_`echo $ac_func | tr 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4376: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
+echo "configure:4371: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4381 "configure"
+#line 4376 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #undef $ac_tr_decl
 #define $ac_tr_decl 1
@@ -4395,7 +4390,7 @@ char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func ;
 #endif
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4399: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4394: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_have_decl_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -4438,12 +4433,12 @@ CFLAGS="$saved_CFLAGS"
 
 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4442: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:4437: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4447 "configure"
+#line 4442 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -4460,7 +4455,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4464: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4459: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -4748,15 +4743,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4752: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:4747: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4760 "configure"
+#line 4755 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -4767,7 +4762,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4771: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4766: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -4790,12 +4785,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4794: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:4789: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4799 "configure"
+#line 4794 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -4844,7 +4839,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:4848: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:4843: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -4865,12 +4860,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4869: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:4864: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4874 "configure"
+#line 4869 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -4898,12 +4893,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4902: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:4897: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4907 "configure"
+#line 4902 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -4936,17 +4931,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4940: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:4935: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4945 "configure"
+#line 4940 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:4950: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:4945: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -4976,12 +4971,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:4980: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:4975: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 4985 "configure"
+#line 4980 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5004,7 +4999,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5008: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5003: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5033,12 +5028,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5037: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5032: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5042 "configure"
+#line 5037 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5061,7 +5056,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5065: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5060: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5095,19 +5090,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5099: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:5094: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5104 "configure"
+#line 5099 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5111: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5106: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -5128,7 +5123,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5132: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:5127: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -5148,7 +5143,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5152: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:5147: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -5167,17 +5162,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5171: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5166: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5176 "configure"
+#line 5171 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5181: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5176: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5194,19 +5189,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5198: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:5193: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5203 "configure"
+#line 5198 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5210: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5205: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
@@ -5222,15 +5217,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5226: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:5221: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'bindtextdomain | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5234 "configure"
+#line 5229 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5241,7 +5236,7 @@ int main() {
 bindtextdomain()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5245: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5240: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -5257,20 +5252,20 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_lib_'$ac_lib_var`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5261: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:5256: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5266: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:5261: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'gettext | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5274 "configure"
+#line 5269 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5281,7 +5276,7 @@ int main() {
 gettext()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5285: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5280: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -5324,7 +5319,7 @@ EOF
 	      # Extract the first word of "msgfmt", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy msgfmt; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5328: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:5323: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_path_MSGFMT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -5358,12 +5353,12 @@ fi
 		for ac_func in dcgettext
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5362: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5357: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5367 "configure"
+#line 5362 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5386,7 +5381,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5390: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5385: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5413,7 +5408,7 @@ done
 		# Extract the first word of "gmsgfmt", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy gmsgfmt; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5417: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:5412: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_path_GMSGFMT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -5449,7 +5444,7 @@ fi
 		# Extract the first word of "xgettext", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy xgettext; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5453: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:5448: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_path_XGETTEXT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -5481,15 +5476,15 @@ else
 fi
 
 		cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5485 "configure"
+#line 5480 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
 			       return _nl_msg_cat_cntr
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5493: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5488: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   CATOBJEXT=.gmo
 		   DATADIRNAME=share
@@ -5514,7 +5509,7 @@ fi
 
         if test "$CATOBJEXT" = "NONE"; then
 	  echo $ac_n "checking whether catgets can be used""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5518: checking whether catgets can be used" >&5
+echo "configure:5513: checking whether catgets can be used" >&5
 	  # Check whether --with-catgets or --without-catgets was given.
 if test "${with_catgets+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_catgets"
@@ -5527,22 +5522,22 @@ fi
 
 	  if test "$nls_cv_use_catgets" = "yes"; then
